body: @yegor256 please, pay attention to this issue

Job [#1304](https://github.com/jcabi/jcabi-github/issues/1304) is now in scope, role is `DEV`

<!-- https://www.0crat.com/footprint/C9R53K5JA/921137517, version: 1.0-SNAPSHOT, hash: 3e63daab -->

The job [#1304](https://github.com/jcabi/jcabi-github/issues/1304) assigned to @llorllale[/z](https://www.0crat.com/u/llorllale), here is [why](https://www.0crat.com/footprint/C9R53K5JA/932135853); the budget is 30 minutes, see [ยง4](http://www.zerocracy.com/policy.html#4); please, read [ยง8](http://www.zerocracy.com/policy.html#8) and [ยง9](http://www.zerocracy.com/policy.html#9); if the task is not clear, read [this](http://www.yegor256.com/2015/02/16/it-is-not-a-school.html) and [this](http://www.yegor256.com/2015/01/15/how-to-cut-corners.html)

<!-- https://www.0crat.com/footprint/C9R53K5JA/932136860, version: 1.0-SNAPSHOT, hash: 8699e2ef -->
@llorllale Some of the puzzles in this project are even > 2-3 years old. So it pays to have a look, maybe they are not applicable anymore :-?

@amihaiemil I think with this onewe can start that refactor you were mentioning earlier. We already have `Notifications`, so we'd just need to add `User.notifications()` and begin fleshing out `RtNotifications`

@amihaiemil ~it doesn't make sense to me that `Repo` should have a `notifications()` attribute.~ now it does: https://developer.github.com/v3/activity/notifications/#list-your-notifications-in-a-repository

But I believe `User.notifications` should also be a thing.
